speaker: Amit Varma
message: When I was growing up, I thought history was something that happened in the past. At its worst, it's a bunch of dates and boring factoids. In India, nowhere do we find these contestations as in the case of Mughal history. Regardless of where the Mughal dynasty itself originated, should we regard them as Indian rulers from whom we took so much that is beautiful about our culture, from our language, our cuisines, and even our clothes, such as the elegant churidar kurtas worn by our Prime Minister? Or should we look at the Mughals as invaders who destroyed temples and massacred Hindus, and who must be avenged by the othering of modern Indian Muslims? This is a political question, but it can only be answered through history.
